Jake & Sydnee

WE'RE GETTING MARRIED

J & S HOME COUPLE STORY EVENTS PEOPLE GALLERY RSVP

The Bride and Groom

Sydnee

I was born in Great Falls, Montana. Moved around a little bit when I was younger to New Mexico and Florida and landed back here in Montana when I was going into 4th grade.


I was involved in sports like volleyball, basketball, cheerleading, and many other extracurricular activities. I graduated high school at Centerville in 2016 and went to college for a year as I had gotten a cheerleading scholarship with the University of Great Falls (University of Providence).


I was hoping that as I continued to be in college while cheerleading that my dream occupation would expose itself, but nothing sounded good to me. I stopped going to college and worked at various jobs, from a grocery store, to a dog boarding facility, to landscaping, to finally landing in the Great Falls Clinic, which is where I have been working for the past year and a half.


I also started selling Scentsy in December of 2020 which has been an amazing experience. Some of my hobbies include camping, hiking, traveling, and being around any and all dogs.

Jake

I was born in Bozeman, Montana and moved to Great Falls when I was about 1 year old. I went to public school until 4th grade and then homeschooled from then until I graduated high school. I graduated Class of 2014 from Christian Liberty Academy out of Illinois.


I did many programs in 4-H as long as I can remember. Dog, archery, and Junior Leader camps were my jam in 4-H. I also helped when needed at livestock shows and sales.


My first job was boarding K9 drug detective dogs for a family friend and slowly moved to lawn mowing and plumbing during the summer. I landed a sweet job at FedEx Ground in 2014 where I worked my way up to manager.


I have been in Montana all my life and proud to call it my home. I currently enjoy working on my '78 Chevy truck, camping/hiking, backroading, and bonfires with friends.

Countdown to the Wedding

Our Love Story

  • First Met - March 30, 2014

    We first met at Centerville's Prom in 2014 where we slowly grew a friendship, only hanging out when mutual friends invited us around to back roading, bonfires, or going to Dairy Queen.

  • First Date - March 2016

    There was a length of time where we stopped communicating and stopped crossing paths as much, but sometime in 2015, is when our friendship really started to flourish. We started talking every day, from the time we would wake up to the time we would go to sleep. We slowly started to hang out more one on one, meeting in the Walmart parking lot to go on little drives around Great Falls or going to get ice cream.

    Everyone noticed that we were getting closer and kept asking when we were going to start dating. It was something that we both denied for months. But finally, on March 27, 2016, we finally realized that we wanted to be more than friends

  • Proposal - April 4, 2020

    That morning we were hanging out at Jake’s house. He wanted to burn some firewood in his fire pit out back. We were sitting there alone, and I just looked up at him and said, “You can marry me already, you know.” He just smirked and we went on with our day.

    When we left to go to my house, we stopped at the top of Giant Springs and looked at the dam. It was windy that day and I did not get out of the truck. But Jake went out and looked at the overflowing dam and came back to the truck and said “You gotta come look at this.” I got out and looked at the dam, and I looked at him and he had this different smirk, I didn’t say anything. To be honest, I was kinda cranky that day so seeing his smirk, I was just like “whatevs.”

    Nothing happens and when we get to my house, my mom was giving him these odd looks because she knew the whole thing was going to go down soon. My parents were sitting down for dinner, but Jake and I had a late lunch and weren’t hungry. So, we got in my 65 Chevy and went for a drive around the neighborhood.

    We went to the gas station to fill up the truck and continued on our way. Jake loves to drive the stick shift, so I asked him if he wanted to drive us home. He said “sure”, so I pulled over, but before I got out, he stopped me and said “Before we switch, I gotta ask you something”, I was like “okay?” And he pulled out the ring and asked me to marry him!

    I was SPEECHLESSSSS. I could not pick my jaw up! So in love, and in so much awe. So, then we drove back to my parents’ house and showed them and then we drove out to his grandparents’ house and my grandparents’ house and told them in person.

    That was something super special to us was being able to tell them face to face. So, we told them, came back to town and started telling our closest family and friends before we announced the next day!

We are going to...
